title: Datepicker
summary: ⁠The datepicker allows users to select a date.
preamble:
Datepickers are used to enter a date. The user can enter the date as numbers using three predefined spinner inputs (year, month, day), or select the date from a calendar popover.

Datepickers helps users avoid formatting errors and makes date entry accessible to assistive technologies.
anatomy-overview: The datepicker consists of an input field with some additional controls to help users select a well-formed date. First, there are three [spinbuttons](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Roles/spinbutton_role), representing day, month and year. These can be configured in any order and with different separators to accommodate different date formats. Second, there is a calendar button, which when activated opens a calendar popover. The calendar popover helps users to visually browse and select a date.
anatomy-details:
1.  Label
    
2.  Input container
    
3.  Input value
    
4.  Trailing icon button

columns.content:
*   Configurable date format display
    
*   Large and small size of the input field
    
*   ‘plain’ mode to hide labels and error messages
    
*   Clearable for quick state reset
    
*   Min and max dates
    
*   Can be configured with visible or hidden week numbers
    
*   Individual dates can be marked as disabled in the calendar
    
*   Buttons in the calendar footer are configurable

Use Datepicker when a complete date should be entered. If only a year, a month, a day, or a combination of two, is needed, use separate input fields or dropdowns. For example, a credit card expiry month.

columns.title: Do's and don'ts
columns.content:
#### Do's

#### Don'ts

*   Use Datepicker when users need to be able to input data other than well-formed dates
    
*   Use only a Datepicker alone when user needs to be able to specify a time. An additional input for time is needed in that case.
    
*   Write out the format in the label. The Datepicker is already constrained to a configured format.
